#summary A movable text object that is attached to a scene node and displayed in the 3D world.

=== Overview ===
A movable text object is attached to a !SceneNode and therefore follows its movement and get smaller when further away and larger when closer.  The text acts like a billboard object, and always faces the camera.
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
=== !CreateMovableText(string font_name, string txt, real x, real y, real color, real alpha) ===
----
Create a movable text object used to display 2D text.
====Parameters====
   * _font_name_ - The unique font resource name for this text.
   * _txt_ - The text to display.
   * _x_, _y_ - The 2D position to start drawing the text.
   * _color_ - The color of the text.
   * _alpha_ - The alpha transparency of the text.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !DestroyMovableText(real text_id) ===
----
Destroys a movable text object.
====Parameters====
   * _text_id_ - The ID of the text.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !SetMovableTextFont(real text_id, string font_name) ===
----
Sets the font resource for a movable text object.
====Parameters====
   * _text_id_ - The ID of the text.
   * _font_name_ - The unique font resource name for this text.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !SetMovableTextCaption(real text_id, string txt) ===
----
Sets the caption for a movable text object.
====Parameters====
   * _text_id_ - The ID of the text.
   * _txt_ - The text to display.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !SetMovableTextColor(real text_id, real color, real alpha) ===
----
Sets the color for a movable text object.
====Parameters====
   * _text_id_ - The ID of the text.
   * _color_ - The color of the text.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !ShowMovableTextOnTop(real text_id, real show) ===
----
Sets whether to show movable text on top or not.
====Parameters====
    * _text_id_ - The ID of the movable text.
    * _show_ - Whether to show text on top or not.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !SetMovableTextAlignment(real text_id, real type) ===
----
Sets the alignment of a movable text object.
====Parameters====
    * _text_id_ - The ID of the text.
    * _horiz_align_ - The type of horizontal alignment to use. Can be:
          * _global.MT_H_LEFT_ - The text is left aligned.
          * _global.MT_H_CENTER_ - The text is centered.
    * _vert_align_ - The type of vertical alignment to use. Can be:
          * _global.MT_V_BELOW_ - The text is vertically aligned below.
          * _global.MT_V_ABOVE_ - The text is vertically aligned above.
          * _global.MT_V_CENTER_ - The text is vertically aligned centered.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !AttachMovableTextToSceneNode(real text_id, real scene_node_id) ===
----
Attaches an movable text object to the specified !SceneNode.
====Parameters====
   * _text_id_ - The ID of the movable text object.
   * _scene_node_id_ - The ID of the !SceneNode.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !SetMovableTextGlobalTranslation(real text_id, real x, real y, real z) ===
----
Sets the global offset position when attached to a scene node.

By default movable text is centered on the scene node.
====Parameters====
    * _text_id - The ID of the text.
    * _x_, _y_, _z_ - The offset position.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !SetMovableTextLocalTranslation(real text_id, real x, real y, real z) ===
----
Sets the local offset position when attached to a scene node.

By default movable text is centered on the scene node.
====Parameters====
    * _text_id - The ID of the text.
    * _x_, _y_, _z_ - The offset position.
<BR>
<BR>
=== !DetachMovableTextFromSceneNode(real text_id, real scene_node_id) ===
----
Detaches an movable text object from the specified !SceneNode.
====Parameters====
   * _text_id_ - The ID of the movable text object.
   * _scene_node_id_ - The ID of the !SceneNode.
<BR>
<BR>
